website_summaries.verdict: Great for taking along on outdoor trips to charge multiple devices, this panel works well even under indirect sunlight.
pros: Owners like the way it folds up for storage and its sturdy protective case
Works well even in partly cloudy conditions
cons: A few issues with defective connectors
Charges much more slowly when not in direct sunlight
Reports of items being charged getting very hot

customer_reviews.title: Perpetual charging station via solar panel #lifehack
customer_reviews.text: 10/10 -IGN Would refer to a friend/friends (and have). Oh and don't forget the external battery to hold onto extra power. This device has smart tech that allows direct plug and play, but if you want to make sure your charge is uninterrupted due to a cloud or anything of that sort, just go ahead and grab an external battery and hook it up to this then run your device through the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Does not charge Apple products
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed that I am unable to charge my iPhone or iPad. You get a message that says the item is not supported. Would have been good to know that before I bought this. I hope to return it trouble free.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to charge devices when no other power is available
customer_reviews.text: I used this thing In the Polar Ural mountains around 67 degrees N and 66 degrees E. I used it to charge a power bank, a Pixel, a Pixel 2 XL and a Galaxy S8. It works really well as long as the sun shines brightly and you keep it oriented towards it, like at a perfect angle. Clouds did affect charging and it would stop completely but the sun was not always very high up in the sky due to the northern latitude so I'll give it a pass on that. It worked great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Florent Rouffignac

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our disaster kit before Hurricane Florence. We live in Eastern North Carolina and It's been raining and cloudy for the past 3 days, so this is the first time I was able to use it. Even with intermittent sun it is charging our devices! It is very easy to use. Just place it in the sun and plug in your device. That's it. So glad I can stop wasting gas just to charge my phone. I would highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: SYR

customer_reviews.title: Works as described but with some drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Product worked mostly as described and seems to produce a fair amount of power. I tested it by charging a BT speaker, 2 different brand external batteries, and a camp light with lithium battery. The only issue I had was that it would not charge my android phone. My phone can charge from a computer usb, wall charger, multi charger, external battery, but NOT FROM THIS PANNEL. So if I wanted to charge my phone I had to charge an external battery first then use the batter on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Bam

customer_reviews.title: Might not last as long as you expect
customer_reviews.text: I really thought this was going to last for a long time, but that thought was short lived. I used it for the first time about 2 weeks after I purchased it, worked great and it took no time to charge my phone and my motorcycle helmet Bluetooth. Second time I used was on a camping trip, also worked great. This last weekend I took it to Mexico with me because I knew I would really need it, wouldn’t work, it simply wouldn’t work, all I got was a buzzing sound whenever I would point it in the direction of the sun. UPDATE, seller sent out a new unit, will update as soon as I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Larrondo

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping, kayaking and other outdoor activities
customer_reviews.text: Nice package and easy to use. Folds compact. Charges the iphone pretty fast. Just make sure you put it close to a shaded area and keep the phone in the shade, otherwise it will overheat. Or cover the phone with something. It will even overheat in the panels pocket as it is all black. Did not use it many times, so far so good. On short trips it's still easier to take one or 2 precharged power banks. But on a longer stay, you can charge the power banks too with this solar charger.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Secerator

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: It actually works, I love it! Larger than expected, but it folds up pretty well. I suppose you need all the solar panels in order to charge so fast. It was charging extra slowly on a cloudy day, but in bright sun during the summer it's wonderful. Note that this doesn't actually HOLD a charge, it just sends it to a device, so you'll need battery packs to charge with this if you want a portable charge, or just charge directly to devices.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase.
customer_reviews.text: After doing research I finally decided to purchase the RAVPower 24W solar panel. I could not be happier. Super durable and very responsive. I highly recommend this for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Defenbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Worked great during hurricane Irma
customer_reviews.text: Worked great during hurricane Irma. Was able to charge 2 battery banks and had lights and cell phone though out storm.
customer_reviews.author: John R

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic! Works perfectly well. It was so nice to charge our phones while camping at the beach so we could keep taking pictures and videos. Obviously, it had a hard time charging when foggy and overcast, but it charged quickly when the sun was out. We laughed a little at the people sneaking extension cords to the bathroom. Well made kit too, by the way. Liked the Velcro pocket and the rings for hooking it up. Sturdy material. I expect it to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Little Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Decent and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this item to have as an additional 'power source' for a bug out box, as well as to have for traveling purposes. Its size is large enough to not be misplaced, yet small enough to allow for easy storage and portability. The ability to have 3 devices charging at once is a huge plus as well. However, the rate at which it charged the items I tested it with was a little slow for my liking. All in all, if you are looking for a decent charger that you can use virtually anywhere - look no further than this.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Lang

customer_reviews.title: Did not work.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbage. I bought it in the aftermath of hurricane Irma in case of another power outage. Never tried until now. Nice sunny day. I plugged my Samsung S5 in to try it out. It was at 75%, checked it 30 minutes later, it had gone down to 68%. The other outlet did not work at all. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Pero

customer_reviews.title: TINY/flimsy velcro pouch for housing the 3 USB cords
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems/feels like quality on this. Have been monitoring the power output with a USB meter and it's very solid. My issue is with the pouch that holds the USB outlets: there's really no room for anything beyond packing the cables. The included manual suggests to put devices you are charging in the pouch, but there simply is no space. I bought a rechargeable battery alongside this (from RAVPower), believing I would be able to store it in the velcro pouch. However, it's not even close to fitting anything other than the attached USB cords, and certainly too small to hold any cell phone.
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Returned item
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the product didn’t work for me. Will only charge my iphone 8+ for up to 20%. 2 of my power banks didn’t charge as well. So sad that I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it and high quality!
customer_reviews.text: This thing rocks! I charged an Iphone 7, bluetooth speaker, and e-cip all at the same time. Everything charged within 4 hours while sitting there fishing listening to music! It's a durable design and very high quality! Super impressed with the quality and how it folds down into a small unit. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Keoni H. Lima

customer_reviews.title: Output half of what is advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Looks really well built and sturdy. Charge was dreadfully slow. In one hour, my battery bank went from 1 percent to 6 percent. Put a multimeter on it and it's only outputting 2.4 volts Max of a blazing New Orleans summer day at noon. Product states that each output should be at 5 volts. Nope. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: No One Ever

customer_reviews.title: Really love this solar panel
customer_reviews.text: Really love this solar panel. A lot cheaper and more powerful than the Goal Zero I also have. Charges my cell phone as fast as most wall chargers in full sun. Best of all it works great with my 167500mah RAVPower Power Bank. They make great products at great prices. Very durable and work well. Three ports is an added plus.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointend
customer_reviews.text: I really was excited about getting this charger. I was about to go to the desert for a month and figured it would be extremely useful. I received the product, and tried it out and it worked pretty well. When I finally got to the desert and wanted to actually use it. It would not work. It would cause the little lightening bolt to appear on my phone as if it was charging, but the percentage would never go up. I thought maybe it was just my phone, so I tried it on other people's devices and same thing. I was extremely disappointed, especially after talking the product up to my peers.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie Scheivert

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to get this product but did not work at all, left phone to charge for a few hours in direct sunlight and although it showed it was charging I ended up taking it off with less battery then I started with. Tried both charging ports as well, shines pretty but doesn’t work... :(
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Wiskoski

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay...
customer_reviews.text: Charger works great if you have good sun exposure. The downfall of this charger is if you lose sun exposure charging stops. You’ll have to detach and reconnect device to continue charging again. So not much of a set it and forget type deal. You’ll have to check on the charge status every so often otherwise you may find your device wasn’t charging. Beware, this is just the solar panel with cables. This does not come with a battery bank. If the charge status continued without having to detach when sun exposure comes and goes I’d give this 5 stars. I’m not sure if this is the product’s fault or just the nature of this type of charger
customer_reviews.author: freshkicks

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as needed.
customer_reviews.text: Decided to use this solar charger on a camping trip to charge devices over several days. It charges very well in direct sunlight. I would recommend first first using it to charge your portable power banks before devices. This ensures that you have stored power for when the sun isn't out. This product was able to charge my power banks, smart phones, JBL Charge 3, cameras, Streamlight Misrostream Coyote, and also charge AA & AAA batteries via a USB battery charger. It was much better than trying to charge all of these things using the cigarette lighter in my truck. While in direct sunlight, charging times were comparable to normal charging at home. Quite happy with this for the price.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Wish was better for price
customer_reviews.text: Is not water resistant as it states, it charges at maybe .75amps, not as close to what it says, it also gets very hot but that's what happens when it's black and in the sun, I wish I had a chance to really use it before the return date was up because it was cloudy out almost the whole time, it also makes a weird buzzing noise from the charger port, wish the charger ports were of better quality but if you really need power this will get it done, I'd rather invest in a battery from anker
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: So this solar charger works very well. It does NOT have a battery of its own but we used it to charge a battery that we could then use at night to charge devices. Charging devices directly also works but be careful if leaving the charger and devices in direct sunlight as overheating is possible. Works best hanging off a backpack in direct sunlight or placed in slightly indirect sunlight if leaving it stationary. The charging is not particularly fast, but we were still able to keeps phones, batteries, and Kindles above the 70% range day in and day out.
customer_reviews.author: J. Levine

customer_reviews.title: Had to return item
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get the RAV Power Solar Charger, as it had such great ratings. The charging cables that came with the Charger, did not fit into my iPhone x or iPhone 7, as stated on description that it would. I called Amazon for tech help - but all they could do was issue a return label. So - I keep looking for another device.
customer_reviews.author: Annika

customer_reviews.title: Overheats and shuts down no matter what I do . .
customer_reviews.text: When sitting inside the house in the window or outside after a very short time it overheats and shuts down completely! (and no it is not being laid flat on a hot surface), very disappointed. Returning this item. Update: Just ordered and received the "BigBlue 5V 28W Solar Charger with Digital Ammeter" today .. it is working flawlessly, much better than this piece of junk did. Buy that one instead of the RavPower. It is much better.
customer_reviews.author: LEGION

customer_reviews.title: Charger works great! Bright sunlight it charges in less than 90 ...
customer_reviews.text: Charger works great! Bright sunlight it charges in less than 90 for my cellphone, and in intermittent clouds 2-3 hours. I've charged my camera, Android and iPhone, Android Tablet, and Kindle without problem. Software that identifies what charge rate to use seems to work as all devices work well after charging. Charging two at a time obviously slows down the charging speed. I work outside and have set the panels flat in the truck bed and am very happy with this device. Planning to take this off the beaten path through out SE Asia.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product has been in my window, in direct ...
customer_reviews.text: This product has been in my window, in direct sunlight since I have purchased the product and ....no juice. There is also no indicator to let me know IF there is a charge. Have written the manufacturer about the problem. Will update this review when I know more.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan L. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping!
customer_reviews.text: I went on a several month car camping trip and this thing was amazing. I didn't have to rely on my car battery. It actually charges faster than an outlet in the desert sun. I charged my cell phone and Kindle Fire HD on it. So light and it folds! Sometimes I'd clip it to the side of my tent and put the electronics in a shady covered part, they will overheat in the pocket in full desert sun and stop charging. Sometimes I just put it on the ground and put the devices in the shade.
customer_reviews.author: Prickly Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Buffalo approved!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my eye on this for some time, and a recent canoe trip finally made me pull the trigger on it. I used it on the Buffalo River in Northern Arkansas the weekend of June 23, 2018. With small bungee cords, it's the perfect size to suspend between the canoe bars for a flat mount to gather sunlight. I don't recall all the details like "how long", "starting battery level", etc, but by the time I thought I'd check it's progress, I found my phone at 100%! Very pleased with this charger!
customer_reviews.author: AdamMc

customer_reviews.title: Time to get prepared
customer_reviews.text: Outfitting a go bag and wanted a solution that didn't require a power source to recharge a power bank. I have plenty of experience of working with solar panels as a consumer electronics product manager and these are great quality panels and an awesome price. There are some other solutions at 3x the price but this hits about 90% of the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Works well but seems to overheat fast
customer_reviews.text: It works really well. I have done a few tests with a large power bank (24k mA) and it charges it at about the same rate as when it is plugged into a power source, maybe a bit faster. That is, when it works. For what ever reason my unit seems to overheat after only using it for 2 to 2 and a half hours and then it stops converting until I bring it inside for around 45 minutes. Not sure if this is just because it is hot as hell down here in Arizona or if there is something wrong with my unit.
customer_reviews.author: George Williams

customer_reviews.title: Simple charger you nat take anywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent charger for round $75 to $77. It'll charge my G6 from 20% to 95% in about 1.5 hrs; your milage may differ. The panels wont flex unles you apply force to them. Do not test the flex on the panels because you can damage the panels. I tried it and a small pop sounded from it. It is very useful in situations where you are camping or the power gets knocked out for more than a few days and need to charge anything small during the day including a flashlight that charges via usb.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Flores

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy, not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if this is a scam product or if it just doesn’t work like it’s advertised. It takes about 30 minutes to get 1% charge on an iPhone in direct sunlight. It doesn’t hold a charge like a power bank, and must be used to directly charge a device. For $70 approximately, you’d think it’d perform well, but it doesn’t. I bought a power bank on here for roughly $40 and it is so much nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Evans

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. While charging my Sony Xperia Z3 at ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. While charging my Sony Xperia Z3 at sea level in full sun i measured 1.5A average charging current, while sitting flat on the ground. Falls a tad short of the 2.4A as advertised but that is "best case" and I didn't expect to see that. Initially appears very superior to my Goal Zero Nomad 7, which was much more expensive. I only wish this had a 12v output option as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ. I have been using it for the last 2 weeks, it works great on sunny days, surprisingly, it still charges on cloudy days, just slower. I just placed it by the window. I tried it on Samsung phone, iphone, ipad and bluetooth speaker, all charges very quickly on sunny days, e.g. the Samsung was down to about 37%, on a sunny day, it can fully charge to 100% within 1-2 hours. I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: "guholio"

customer_reviews.title: I love the flexible design that allows for hanging on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Durable construction, fast charging with device directly plugged into the available USB port. I did a test at home. Plugged my Android Phone into a wall outlet at 89% battery. Message on phone said 15 minutes till fully charged. I then moved the device to the RAVPower solar charger in full sun and after plugging in, the same message popped up on my phone. I also plugged a partially spent spare battery into the second USB port on the charger. In 15 minutes, my phone was charged to full and my battery backup was charged. I love the flexible design that allows for hanging on the outside of my backpack while hiking through the day.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Better than the rest of them
customer_reviews.text: Really nice portable solar set up. It charges the RavPower powerbank I have fairly quickly. It folds up into a neat little package that fits in my daypack. I can put it practically anywhere and as long as there is some light it will be charging. I have used it inside sunny windows up against the windowpane with good results.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: RAV POWER 26800 POWER PACK
customer_reviews.text: After testing on the road for 1 1/2 years now in the RV I have to say that I really liked this product, however the charge port micro mini has broken and there is'nt anyway to charge it even though the cells are still good. I don't have the funds to purchase another one. RAV POWER please make this more durable on the charging port, the outdoor life is hard on these devices and a mini charging port does'nt cut it. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Works. Well.
customer_reviews.text: Shipped as promised. End of the day, winter in Texas, got 5 percent charge in about 12 minutes minutes on a Nexus 6P using usb to usb C. Light. Seems quality. Honestly plug and play. If you're racking your brain on this or another brand's 20W+ panel, get this one. It does what it says, and the advertising is less BS than the competitors, which is nice to see. Wife remarked how small and light for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: AlldoneAbe

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a Solar Panel That Works as Advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Wow. After being disappointed with the fancy well-known brand, sold at the "big box" store, for three times the price, I wasn't holding my breath. First thing I noticed was its compact size and light weight. Then I noticed it was made out of durable material. When I tried it outside on a partially-sunny day in an enclosed balcony, and it starting charging my cell phone, I was impressed! If your Goal is to have Zero problems, I would definitely go with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't charge and over heats, I lose charge from the phone. Even after contacting seller they gave me tips on how to use it was pretty much was how I had it setup for use. I was really hoping to would work great but after 3 months of testing solar panel charger it's new home is the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This rocks
customer_reviews.text: This thing absolutely rocks. I had pretty high expectations but this exceeded them. My idea was to use this with my battery packs to charge my USB devices at a later time. One of the battery packs, 3200 mAh pack, charged from dead to full in about 2 hours on a bright sunny day. I charged my 28000 mAh pack in a little under 6 hours on a partly cloudy day. This is a great item for a couple day backpack to keep your phone, GPS, LED lights, etc., charged when no commercial power is available.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Dunlap

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work very well
customer_reviews.text: I tested this out on a cloudy day and then again on a super sunny day (in Texas). Totally unimpressed. With clouds , it effectively didn't charge my phone at all. In full sun, it charged about 10% in almost two hours. For me that's just not good enough. I am going to try a different brand I suppose, bc the idea of this thing is terrific. I just wish it actually charged my phone well. Having said that, it seems well constructed . Maybe if my only goal was to charge power banks (slowly) I would keep it. But, for my purposes this won't cut it .
customer_reviews.author: J. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I’ve used others, Goal Zero, etc. This one worked best. Plenty of charging power. Would fully charge my battery packs by days end. A little on the heavy side, but that’s the trade off for power. We spent two weeks hiking off-grid in the mountains of New Mexico. Others in our party had different solar chargers. They all failed or failed to perform. This unit never failed to do its task.
customer_reviews.author: HtownTaco

customer_reviews.title: I really like this solar charger
customer_reviews.text: I really like this solar charger. It is fast, efficient, and well built. When I Googled Solar Chargers it was one that was list with other top chargers, didn't break the wallet, and fast charge rate. Will work great camping, hiking, and hunting for extended trips. I can charge phones, batteries for Wicked Hunting Lights (with a USB charger), rechargeable head lamps (flashlight), hunting hearing enhancers, and other electronic devices. I really like the i-smart technology knowing it won't damage anything that is plugged into it. The customer service is excellent and when I registered the charger I received an extended warranty. Yes I would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Better than sliced bread.
customer_reviews.text: I live in the Peruvian Amazon without electricity. I use this solar panel charger several times a week to charge my cel phone and four headlamps. Today, I just charged my cel phone in 4 hours during an overcast sky with drizzling rain. I am impressed. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: G1R2

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I put this in direct sunlight it doesn't work.. my phone the battery number went down a point after being plugged in for an hour
customer_reviews.author: AI

customer_reviews.title: Works great, and packs small enough to hide in a motorcycle bag.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great right out of the gate. I bought it for motorcycle trips, camping and other "away from home" adventures. The output is plenty enough to charge three of our helmet communication devices quickly and simultaneously once we got to camp. A little more daylight and it handled a couple of camera batteries as well. I'm sold, and I would purchase it again. Let's see how it does in the long-term test...
customer_reviews.author: Brian Crumpacker

customer_reviews.title: Might be better to get another item.
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend buying. Even with no clouds in the sky it took about half a day to charge one phone. I tried making sure it always faced the sun but found that if i just laid it flat it would charge better.
customer_reviews.author: maria cervantes

customer_reviews.title: Just add sun!
customer_reviews.text: I end up “seriously” off the grid every year, way beyond the “last village.” Works as advertised, just add sunlight. Worthless in triple canopy rainforest! Amazing in a desert!
customer_reviews.author: Coobat2

customer_reviews.title: Smart charging makes it very versatile
customer_reviews.text: Seems well constructed & worked well on testing using a dead OnePlus 3 phone with Dash Charger (over 4A rating) & a 12V DC usb cable to charge a couple 18650 LiOn batteries. Far exceeding the normal ranges for a 15w panel. The smart charger & use of 3.0+ usb gives the flexibility to charge pretty much any small devices or batteries you could have. This is far superior to what you might expect from an older standard 5v usb charger on 16 watt panels! I'm actually very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work after a year
customer_reviews.text: I was originally excited about the product but sadly, it no longer works. It was always slow to charge my phone when u first got (even on bright sunny days in Texas). But a year after the purchase, I can leave my phone plugged into it outside all day and the percentage does not change. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Bluford

customer_reviews.title: It gets hot in the sun and so does device being charged
customer_reviews.text: I used this often to keep my portable devices charged while in use: good news it works well. However it will stop charging once device is full of battery life; it will also itself get hot in the sun, a potential problem I avoided by bringing it in once it was finished charging. Cannot leave it out in the sun (I didn't want to either).
customer_reviews.author: Denise Bleak

customer_reviews.title: Works and is durable
customer_reviews.text: Seems durable enough but you probably need to pack it just right in a backpack. I could see it cracking under pressure. The fabric border will last years. Under direct sunlight it took my galaxy s6 edge plus from 59%-85% in a little less than an hour. It's aight, but if treated right, should outlast the device you have plugged into it and will definitely serve well on 2-7 day hikes. If it was a tad faster It'd be instant 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Isleofdoggos

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Managed to charge a iPhone 5s from 30% to 100% in under two hours. Keeps my 7+ charged and even tops it off while being used on a overcast day. I am quite happy with the results. Some judgement free remarks: Would be nice if they bundled it with a small power bank. But as it’s not in the description, no points taken. It comes with two micro USB adapters, no lightning though. Again, not in the description, no points taken.
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Stefan

customer_reviews.title: DJ Approved!
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from a 5 day camping trip, and of course, couldn't be without my music! The panel worked GREAT to power my ipad which was connected to my JBL mini speaker. Had tunes all day without draining the power on my little solar powered camper. Only thing i will comment, is that if using this way, it does not CHARGE the ipad, as I suspect the power is being used to run the equipment. BUT, it runs all day without discharge, and I can re-charge in the evening.
customer_reviews.author: Taos_gal

customer_reviews.title: A hiking photographer's perfect tool
customer_reviews.text: This bad boy folds up nice and compactly and is actually quite lightweight all considering. I'm a big camping/hiker with emphasis on photography so I often run into the issues with needing to carry lots of extra batteries etc. Now I can drape these panels over the back of my backpack when walking about or lay it out at camp and charge up my power bank to then get many sequential device charges with or without sun. All in all, very fond of the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Great, even in overcast
customer_reviews.text: I love this little solar panel! It works way better in low light then my giant folding, other brand 60W panel. I also love my giant power bank I got from them, and plan on getting a flexible solar (for on top of my roof cargo box) as soon as I am able. I use this one mainly to run fans and charge phone/power bank.
customer_reviews.author: FP

customer_reviews.title: ... solar panels and found this RAVPOWER to be the best. I looked at several evaluation videos comparing different ...
customer_reviews.text: I looked at many solar panels and found this RAVPOWER to be the best. I looked at several evaluation videos comparing different Portable Solar panels and this one so far seems to be spot on with it's claims. The output voltage and AMPS were producing the right levels needed to charge my iPhone and iPad II, I used the DROK 2.0 USB Multi-Meter to verify the output form the panel, I would definetley recommend getting one as you can tell if you have the panel position correctly to the Sun to get the most Voltage and amps. This Solar panel is well made and durable. I would recommnad
customer_reviews.author: D. King

customer_reviews.title: really useful
customer_reviews.text: Me and two others used this to keep our phones and cameras charged on a long drive across India. While the sun was out, it worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ger

customer_reviews.title: Overall I am pleased as I can charge my phone when away from ...
customer_reviews.text: This charges my Samsung galaxy note 3 with no problems. It doesn't charge the ravpower 15000mAh deluxe portable charger though. I've tried on several different occasions on cloudless days. It starts off alright and flashes as if it is charging but when I checked it a couple hours later it was turned off and the charge level had not changed. Overall I am pleased as I can charge my phone when away from the grid but I had hoped be able to charge the back up battery back at camp while I took my phone with me. Maybe it'll work with a different battery back up, just not the one I bought.
customer_reviews.author: L. C. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Don't work at all !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a trip that didnt happen. Tried it now for first time to make sure I could use it for the trek to Everest base camp and it isnt charging at all. Tried on different phones and other usb powered item and it won't even show charging. It's only my fault I didn't test it after I got it and now it's too late.
customer_reviews.author: T. Skorka

customer_reviews.title: Great product, especially if hiking or camping
customer_reviews.text: This product has been extremely helpful while out on hikes I just clip it to my Camelback, plug in my backup battery charger and can just forget it's there. Then at night when my phone dies I have my backup battery to keep it going in case of emergencies. Obviously it doesn't charge as well on cloudy days that it does in direct sunlight, but it still charges.
customer_reviews.author: Basil Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Garbage - received broken used item
customer_reviews.text: I paid $50 usd for this RAV solar charger, however, upon using it in bright and direct sunlight, it pulses my devices charging then no charging over and over, continued usage would result in destroying my device's batteries. Upon inspecting the panels, they are clearly cracked in several places. There was not any tape on the box, just a single cardboard flap. I can see this unit has been returned already, by the untidy state of one of the USB cables provided. I threw this crap away, since clearly if I return it, they will simply scam another victim. Thanks for stealing my money and wasting my time.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bearden

customer_reviews.title: Power on the Go
customer_reviews.text: No Electricity in the Mayan Village in Belize, used this to charge my Iphone 7 to record audio and video, fast recovery!
customer_reviews.author: Henry S.

customer_reviews.title: I’m happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a rustic camping trip with no electricity. I draped the charger over the back of my chair as we were sitting around camp, and kept my iPhone charged! Easy to use. Good quality. Compact. Doesn’t charge super fast, but that was known before purchase- no big deal if you plan ahead and don’t let your phone charge get too low. Only downside is the included power/USB cords. They are NOT lightning cords so had to supply my own cord for iPhone. Good price point- plan on buying several of these for Christmas gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Gravelle

customer_reviews.title: Buzzing sound of failure
customer_reviews.text: The solar panels and case are well built but the cheap Chinese charge controlers inside do not work. They turn off after a few seconds and make a buzzing sound. The only way to get it to start charging again was to cover all the panels and uncover again. Only for it to stay on another few seconds. This was on a clear Florida day at high noon so sunlight was not the problem. Definitely not worth the money. Consider finding another solar charger if you want something that works
customer_reviews.author: ivan

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this solar charger!
customer_reviews.text: Took it to my annual training for the National Guard and it was well worth it! 2 weeks and kept everyone's phones and extra batteries charged! Took a while to charge but it worked like a charm and everyone in my platoon will soon be buying one for themselves!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Charges phone faster than I expected, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: This has been sitting in my window for a couple months, passively charging USB batteries. In full sunlight it charges my iphone in an hour or two. Seems to work great.
customer_reviews.author: homeslices

customer_reviews.title: It's nice
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a very high quality product. I only had it out in the sun for about 15 minutes to test it, and it charged my iphone 4% higher. The panels, case, stitching, all seem like a good design and manufacture. Definitely not cheap junk.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S.

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any environmentally friendly, USB device user!
customer_reviews.text: I love this panel, I hung it outside my door and use 10 ft USB extension cables to bring the power inside. On really sunny days I am able to also use a 4 way USB splitter. As I am writing this the panel is: Charging an IPhone 6s, Charging a Bluetooth speaker, charging an external battery pack, and powering 2 USB fans!!! It's honestly an amazing little panel!
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Small Light Design But Charging Ability is Limited
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for backpacking (powering my water sanitizer/Steripen, GPS, and cell phone which I use for photo's). The product works but wish it did a better job powering the devices. About 3 hours in direct sun increased my cell phone power by about 30%. Effectively I'd need to have my phone attached to this thing all day - probably more - to get a full charge. Still, it worked, was light, and folds flat for easy packing.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B

customer_reviews.title: Great product that charges fast!
customer_reviews.text: Great product and charges devices at a good rate. Bought this for my dad to use on the beach to charge our phones (HTC ones), iPod (ipod touch) and a portable speaker. The speaker won't charge but it will sustain it which is understandable because the speaker is pretty big for that charger anyways. For the phones it will charge two phones to full power very quickly. Probably quicker then a normal outlet which is pretty awesome but it probably can be attributed to not messing with them (on the beach). Used this with good sunlight and without and both ways it worked great. I would recommend this to anyone and might by another for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: works as it said
customer_reviews.text: I like rav stuff. So I got the solar panel. The first time I owned one. This charged everything I attached. It started working the second the sun came over the treeline and until the sun was on the sunset. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Great charging outdoors - good for camping
customer_reviews.text: It works really well in good sun. I was impressed with its ability to charge my phone and I like its compact fold up design. Its not tiny, about the size of a Nat Geo magazine but definitely portable
customer_reviews.author: Lamorna Brown Swigart

customer_reviews.title: It is good looking and does fold up small but the charge ...
customer_reviews.text: for the price I expected more. It is good looking and does fold up small but the charge output is VERY slow. Drove from Nashville to Galveston TX left my iPhone plugged into it (phone in airplane mode) and after a full day in the sun (propped in the windshield) it took my phone from nearly dead to less than 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: toddinnv

customer_reviews.title: Its small, light, and powerful...just what your phone needs.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I love how it folds up into a neat little package for storage and then can quickly be pulled out and unfolded in seconds. It comes with two USB ports and a little pocket to slide your phone or other small device into to help keep it out of the sun. I purchased it to mainly put in my emergency kit in case the power goes off for an extended time, but I have taken it with me on camping trips and hikes. Every single time I've used it...its worked like a charm. If you want to make sure you can always charge up your phone...then this thing will do the trick. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: EEstep

customer_reviews.title: Expensive solar lesson
customer_reviews.text: Second and last. Tough lesson... you just have to spend more money on the better panels. Very poor performance... good case, bad technical panel performance. Looking now to resell it for a kid's science project... pretty much all it's good for.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleCustomer

customer_reviews.title: This is not bad, it chargers the phone and IPad adequately
customer_reviews.text: This is not bad, it chargers the phone and IPad adequately. You must ensure you use a short USB cable though. A long one takes forever. If you charge one item at a time it is much faster. All in all it serves its purpose. I love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: ODonald

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product on two different camping/backpacking trips and I am really impressed with quality and charging power. It hangs easily from backpack and is light weight. The price is also great. I have wanted to try a portable solar panel but could not justify the price of other companies. This one is worth trying.
customer_reviews.author: bcarey

customer_reviews.title: Great Solar Charger adds peace of mind driving long trips
customer_reviews.text: I travel by car a lot and wanted to have a safe and convenient way to charge my electronic devices if a problem came up. Excellent charging system which gives my family a great peace of mind as we are driving. I have used it on sunny as well as cloudy days without a problem. The case is well put together and seems very sturdy. 5 stars for a great product. Looking for other items you might have.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Rawstern

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again and definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome device - love the hooks and holes to attach to nearly everything, and the two USB ports are $$ for you and a friend. I took this to beach camping and it charged my HTC One m8 no prob bob. My wife's iPhone 5c gave gripes "accessory not supported" sometimes, but that was mainly when it was overcast. Great charging times, nearly as good as the wall on a sunny day (e.g. 10% to 100% in two hours). Water resistant and sand resistant, very compact, easily connectable. The ONLY reason I docked one star is because I would give it 4.5 and not 5, because I'm totally picky like that ATM.
customer_reviews.author: K Tell

customer_reviews.title: Charge it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good solar charger. I have two others, this is the highest rated wattage. I used it for the first time a couple of weekends ago on a camping trip to charge my iPhone 6. I was mostly sunny with a few clouds and the charger continued to supply current without any obvious interruptions. I plugged my USB power meter in between the solar panel and iPhone to monitor the output. The charge time was fairly quick and steady. Feels rugged and durable. Nice design and reasonably priced...
customer_reviews.author: fargozombie

customer_reviews.title: ... my decision after reading many reviews- This product is great if your weather will be clear and sunny
customer_reviews.text: Made my decision after reading many reviews- This product is great if your weather will be clear and sunny . - My issue was it rained about 50% of the time I needed to it and basically was useless on those days. . On clear days I was able to charge my Anker power bank (highly recommended ) and charge my devises at night. Need little bigger pouch to keep your electronics while being charged. Friend had much smaller hard case unit that was weather protected and charged during wet weather. For the money however I was able to keep all my devices charged for 17 days in Alaska.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Cardillo

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product!
customer_reviews.text: It has been only a few days but this thing is doing what it says. Charges my iPhone X 1% in every minute or so (Definitely much faster than the charger comes with the phone). Build quality is also very good. I live in Turkey and we have power outages every now and then and we don't have land line in our home any longer so we highly depend on our cell phones. It is great to know that we no longer rely on the power grid. I think it is very important to have a solar solution for your basic needs so I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mersin

customer_reviews.title: Great to attach to hiking pack
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as I had hoped. Unfolds and clips to my backpack while hiking. I charge a small battery pack all day while I’m hiking and then use it when I need it. Powered my devices for all 2,650 miles of the PCT.
customer_reviews.author: scott m spencer

customer_reviews.title: Work in rain or with clouds
customer_reviews.text: So I have had this for about a month and have been using it every day for the last 10 days to charge my phone in the woods. It is my only charging source out here. I plug in my phone for 3-4 hours every afternoon and by the end my battery has been at 90-100 percent. Considering I’m in the PNW and have rain and clouds all days but two this is fantastic I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: (15W) Use this charger for beach and camping purposes in Hawaii. In strong light it is putting out close to 2A. With strong light, it charges the cell phone just as fast as the cig outlet. Construction: very happy with the construction. The device feels very sturdy. Also the cells have stood up to the sandy beach environment and have not scratched or clouded over time. The pocket is a welcome addition as you can place your phone or other device under the flap.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Reviews

customer_reviews.title: This Device Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This solar charger works very well for charging cell phones. Not enough juice to charge a full size IPAD, but for a cell phone in direct sunlight - it’s awesome, and fun for us geeks! It works best in full sunlight, cloudy days definitely affects it, but it’s a SOLAR charger. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cradduck

customer_reviews.title: WHEN YOU ARE OUT OF POWER...
customer_reviews.text: works as described, tested 2 cellphone, 2 tablets and 2 power banks. Must be on a direct sunlight to maximized it's potential. if you are indoors and your windows have any kind of protective sunlight paper be sure to open it up or it will not work well.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Rosales G

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and practical
customer_reviews.text: I tried it on an overcast day, and it still charges my Note 5. It really does have enough power (24 watts) to do the job. Good for hikers, campers, and as an emergency power source to keep in your car.
customer_reviews.author: kkrome25

customer_reviews.title: Great solar charger, AMAZING durability
customer_reviews.text: This charger works very well. More impressively, I left it on top of my car and it fell off while driving. I saw two cars run over it before I was able to retrieve it. The USB connectors got smooshed and the plastic casings popped off but all of the circuitry was just fine. Still works great. I'm VERY impressed with this items durability.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Karmis

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This charger survived a month of paleontological fieldwork in the Wyoming badlands; it worked fairly fast (comparable to charging off a car battery) and held up against dust/mud and even some light rain. Cons: The included carabiner clips unfortunately broke almost instantly, and I didn't bring replacements on my trip. The unit was sometimes awkward to stand against tents without it falling over in the strong winds. I recommend buying this along with a battery pack (to store up power for use at night/on rainy days) if you're going to be relying on it for an extended trip.
customer_reviews.author: bernp

customer_reviews.title: Order this product to use for long distant bicycle touring ...
customer_reviews.text: Order this product to use for long distant bicycle touring. It arrived 3 days before Irma made landfall in Naples. Used it during several days of electric outage to recharge cell phones and rechargeable fan. Worked very well in direct sunlight. Does what it claims.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Charges quickly when used right
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with the charger at first. Then the seller contacted me and provided with instructions. You should put charger out in the sun first, then connect the usb cable to the charger and finally connect the other end to your phone. This way it charges the iphone and ipad. Seller is great, reliable and trustworthy. I will not hesitate to purchase another RAVPower product on my next charger / power bank need.
customer_reviews.author: Bilal Okatan

customer_reviews.title: RAVpower 15W Solar Charger with Dual USB Port
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this device and am very much enjoying it so far. I have been able to use it to charge the RAVpower Deluxe 13000mAh external battery pack, as well as rechargeable AA and AAA batteries using the Sun Jack USB Battery Charger. I had this solar panel out of it's package and in the sun charging these devices very quickly, meaning to say, I find t very easy to use. Also, it is great to know that the iSmart Technology present in this solar charger is helping devices to charge more appropriately/effectively. The delivery of this product was great in my experience. I am grateful for the opportunity to use such a great device!
customer_reviews.author: Scot T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Solar Charger
customer_reviews.text: I was in Shawnee National Forest for 8 days in August. Got there early to make sure I had a campsite from which to view the solar eclipse. During my stay I used the product multiple times to charge my cell phone. It worked great! Charged my phone fast in direct sun, slower in thin overcast.
customer_reviews.author: Frank K

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: The first test was to hold the panel in cloudy conditions and test the output to charge iPhone & mophie battery combination. It’s seem to work very well and I anticipate it should continue as such And even better in bright sunlight. The quality seems reasonable for carrying in a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Stoneadventures

customer_reviews.title: Good but not Great
customer_reviews.text: It works in direct sunlight and gives a slow charge but anything shy of direct light doesn't really charge. Still good if you are in the southwest or expecting sunny days.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

product_meta.title: RAVPower Solar Charger 16W Solar Panel with Dual USB Port Waterproof Foldable Camping Travel Charger Compatible iPhone Xs XS Max XR X 8 7 Plus, iPad, Galaxy S9 S8 Edge Plus, Note, LG, Nexus and More
product_meta.description:
Important Note:

1. Please DO place the solar panel in direct sunlight to get the most efficient energy conversation.

2. Please DO NOT place solar panels behind windows. This may significantly reduced energy conversation.

3. Please DO NOT lay the solar panel directly on CONCRETE FLOOR, SAND OR other easy-heat-conduction place when charging. Doing so will overheat the solar panel. This may significantly reduced the conversion rate to prevent outputting efficient wattage.

The Less The Waste, The More The Power RAVPower highly efficient solar cells convert up to 21. 5-23. 5% of solar power into free energy. Make sure to always get the most power you can, whether it is a sunny day or you are hiking under a cloudy sky. Plug in up to two devices at once and let Nature take care of the rest.

Smaller, Yet Powerful A lightweight portable device that will be no nuisance during your most adventurous treks. Hook it up to your backpack, tent, or up the nearest tree, and make sure to get as much power out of the sun as possible. The ideal choice for camping, hiking, cycling, and any other outdoor activity where fun matters and running out of power cannot be a concern.

Charge Smarter The advanced combination of iSmart and Smart IC technologies will detect all connected devices' individual input and distribute the total output accordingly to the appropriate charge they can benefit from. Let Nature meet the best technology has to offer.

Weatherproof A finely refined waterproof fabric to outlast whatever the weather throws at it. Even water. Equipped with 4 practical hooks to always catch as much sunlight as possible, and 2 iSmart USB cables, you'll have the best travel companion for your smartphone, camera, and any other USB device that ran out of juice.

What's In the Box:

1 x RAVPower 16W Dual-Port Outdoors Charger

2 x USB Charging Cables

4 x Hooks
